title: Research: Analyze motion.zajno.com for motion design patterns
description:
## Goal
Analyze https://motion.zajno.com/ to understand their motion design approach and determine what we can replicate.

## Key Questions
- How do the project components load/animate?
- What techniques are used (CSS animations, GSAP, WebGL, or simpler approaches)?
- Is full WebGL actually needed, or can we achieve similar effects with CSS/JS?
- Can we add 3D effects to project cards without heavy WebGL?

## Performance Analysis
- [ ] Check frame rate during animations (target: 60fps+)
- [ ] Check scroll smoothness
- [ ] Test on mobile device
- [ ] Check Core Web Vitals (LCP, FID, CLS)
- [ ] Note any jank or performance issues

## Mobile Analysis
- [ ] Test responsive behavior
- [ ] Check touch interactions
- [ ] Verify accelerometer/gyro effects (if any)
- [ ] Note any mobile-specific degradation

## Deliverables
Catalog of motion design types with one example of each:
- [ ] Page load animations
- [ ] Scroll-triggered animations  
- [ ] Hover/interaction effects
- [ ] Project card animations (with 3D potential)
- [ ] Transitions between sections

## Context
Shifting focus from 'scrollytelling' to broader 'motion design'. Want wow factor without overengineering. Must be smooth and work well on mobile.
close_reason: Research complete. Key finding: motion.zajno.com achieves wow factor WITHOUT WebGL using Lenis (3KB smooth scroll) + GSAP ScrollTrigger + CSS transforms/clip-path. Documented in research/motion-zajno-analysis.md

title: Scene: The Speaker (talks showcase)
description:
## Scene 4: The Speaker

### Visual
- Photos/clips of past talks
- Conference logos
- "Available for speaking" CTA

### Motion Design (from research)
**Primary principles:** Fade, Stagger, Dimension
**Secondary:** Parallax
**Animation tier:** A-tier (GSAP + CSS)

### Animation Spec
1. **Photo gallery entry:**
   - Staggered fade-in (0.15s apart)
   - Each photo: opacity 0→1, translateY(30px)→0
   - Slight rotation variation (-2deg to 2deg)

2. **Conference logos:**
   - Horizontal scroll or grid
   - Fade in as group
   - Subtle grayscale → color on hover

3. **CTA button:**
   - Pulses subtly to draw attention
   - Hover: scale(1.05) + shadow

4. **Dimension:**
   - Photos stack with slight overlap
   - Z-index creates depth
   - Shadow gradients

### Assets Required
- [ ] 3-5 talk photos (webp, ~800px wide)
- [ ] Conference logos (SVG preferred)
- [ ] Speaking reel video clip (optional)

### Interactions
- Click photo: lightbox or expand
- CTA → Contact/booking page

### Mobile
- Horizontal swipe gallery
- Single column layout
- Tap to expand photos

title: Scene: Content Creator (3D YouTube embed)
description:
## Scene 3: The Content Creator

### Visual
- 3D YouTube embed with perspective effect
- Floating/tilted appearance
- Recent video from channel

### Motion Design (from research)
**Primary principles:** Zoom, Masking
**Secondary:** Dimension
**Animation tier:** A-tier (CSS 3D transforms)

### Animation Spec
1. **Entry animation:**
   - Scale from 0.8 → 1.0
   - Rotate from rotateY(-15deg) → rotateY(-5deg)
   - Duration: 0.8s cubic-bezier

2. **Resting state:**
   ```css
   transform: perspective(1000px) rotateY(-5deg) rotateX(2deg);
   box-shadow: 20px 20px 60px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);
   ```

3. **Hover:**
   - Flatten: rotateY(0deg) rotateX(0deg)
   - Lift: translateZ(20px)
   - Shadow softens

4. **Click/focus:**
   - Zoom to fill more viewport
   - Video plays

### Technical Implementation
- Use lite-youtube-embed for performance
- Intersection Observer for lazy load
- CSS 3D transforms (NO WebGL needed)

### Assets Required
- [ ] YouTube channel ID / recent video ID
- [ ] Custom thumbnail fallback

### Mobile
- Reduce 3D tilt effect
- Touch to play
- Smaller shadow

title: Scene: The Coder (keyboard, GitHub viz)
description:
## Scene 1: The Coder

- Animated typing keyboard → Links to X.com

**Animation tier:** A-tier (GSAP + CSS transforms)

title: Scene: 8 Claude Codes (parallel terminals)
description:
## Scene 2: 8 Claude Codes

### Visual
- 8 terminal windows in 2x4 grid (desktop) / 2x2 visible (mobile)
- Each showing Claude Code working in parallel
- Realistic terminal aesthetic (dark theme)

### Motion Design (from research)
**Primary principles:** Stagger, Fade
**Secondary:** Dimension
**Animation tier:** A-tier (GSAP + CSS)

### Animation Spec
1. **Terminal appearance** (staggered):
   - Each terminal fades in with translateY(20px)
   - Stagger: 0.1s apart (0.8s total for all 8)
   - Order: top-left to bottom-right

2. **Terminal content:**
   - Each terminal has scrolling text
   - Different content per terminal (variety)
   - CSS animation: translateY loop

3. **Hover effect:**
   - Individual terminal lifts (translateY(-4px))
   - Shadow increases
   - Scale(1.02)

### Assets Required
- [ ] Terminal frame design (CSS or SVG)
- [ ] 8 different code snippets/outputs
- [ ] Claude Code ASCII art or logo

### CSS Structure
```css
.terminal-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 1fr);
  gap: 1rem;
}
.terminal {
  background: #1a1a1a;
  border-radius: 8px;
  font-family: monospace;
}
```

### Mobile
- Show 2x2 grid (4 terminals visible)
- Or horizontal scroll carousel
- Reduce text scrolling speed

title: Hero Section: Desert landscape with parallax
description:
## Hero / Landing Section

### Visual
- Desert landscape / nature backdrop
- Parallax depth effect
- "CHRIS DILGER" title
- "Software Engineer" subtitle

### Motion Design (from research)
**Primary principles:** Parallax, Masking, Easing
**Secondary:** Fade, Dimension

### Animation Spec
1. **Page load sequence** (stagger 0.1s apart):
   - Background layers fade in
   - Title text: `cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1)` + translateY(-20px)
   - Subtitle: fade + translateY
   - Scroll indicator: pulse animation

2. **Parallax layers:**
   - Sky: static or slow CSS gradient shift
   - Mountains: `yPercent: -20` on scroll
   - Mid dunes: `yPercent: -35` on scroll
   - Foreground: `yPercent: -50` on scroll

3. **Scroll reveal:** Hero content clips out via `clip-path: inset()` as user scrolls

### Assets Required
- [ ] desert-sky.webp (or CSS gradient)
- [ ] desert-mountains.png (transparent, ~1920x600)
- [ ] desert-dunes-mid.png (transparent, ~1920x400)
- [ ] desert-foreground.png (transparent, ~1920x300)

### Performance
- 120fps target
- CSS transforms only (GPU accelerated)
- Lazy load below-fold layers

### Mobile
- Reduce parallax intensity (50% of desktop)
- Touch-friendly scroll
- `prefers-reduced-motion`: static fallback
